Gukanshō, pp. 282-283; Varley, H. Paul. (1980). Jinnō Shōtōki, p. 164; ==Traditional history== Before he became the monarch, this prince's personal name (imina) was .Titsingh, p. 103; Brown, p. 282. Junna had six Empresses and Imperial consorts and 13 Imperial sons and daughters.Brown, p. 282. ===Events of Junna's life=== Junna was Crown Prince for 13 years. * 810 (Kōnin 1): Prince Ōtomo was named the heir of Emperor Saga at 25 years of age. * 30 May 823 (Kōnin 14, 17th day of the 4th month): In the 14th year of Emperor Saga's reign, the monarch abdicated. The succession (senso) was received by Prince Ōtomo, who was Saga's younger brother. Soon afterwards, the prince is said to have said to have acceded to the throne (sokui).Brown, pp. 282-283. This was confirmed in ceremonies.Varley, p. 44; a distinct act of senso is unrecognized prior to Emperor Tenji; and all sovereigns except Jitō, Yōzei, Go-Toba, and Fushimi have senso and sokui in the same year until the reign of Emperor Go- Murakami. Compare Imperial Household Agency (Kunaichō), Ceremony of Accession (Sokui-no-Rei); retrieved 2011-12-23. * 22 March 833 (Tenchō 10, 28th day of the 2nd month): In the 10th year of Emperor Junna's reign, he abdicated; and the succession (senso) was received by a his adopted son, who would be known as Emperor Ninmyō. * 11 June 840 (Jōwa 7, 8th day of the 5th month): Former- Emperor Junna died at the age of 55.Brown, p. 283; Varely, p. 164. ===After his death=== According to the Imperial Household Agency, the mausoleum (misasagi) of Junna is in Nishikyō-ku, Kyoto. The emperor is traditionally venerated at a memorial Shinto shrine at this location. ==Eras of reign== The years of Junna's reign are identified by more than one era name (nengō).Titsingh, p. 102. * Kōnin (810-824) * Tenchō (824-834) ==Related pages== * Emperor of Japan * List of emperors of Japan * Japanese imperial family tree ==References== Category:Emperors of Japan Category:786 births Category:840 deaths
